definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: Part of your audience wants to see the pianist and presenter.
sentences.chinese: 一部分观众想要看到钢琴演奏者和演示者。
那钢琴演奏者兼作萨克斯管吹奏员。

sentences.english: Consider the case of piano virtuoso Leon Fleisher.
sentences.chinese: 考虑弗莱舍案件钢琴演奏家莱昂。

sentences.english: Mr Brain has just heard Zheng Jie playing the piano in a concert .
sentences.chinese: 布雷恩先生刚刚听了郑杰在音乐会上的钢琴演奏。

sentences.english: I have been a struggling piano player for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，我一直是个离钢琴家很遥远的钢琴演奏者。

sentences.english: Chuck Norris can play the violin with a piano.
sentences.chinese: 罗礼士可以用钢琴演奏小提琴。

sentences.english: Chapter Four examines the history of two pianos and gives suggestions on the performing of two pianos works.
sentences.chinese: 第四章则是关于双钢琴历史与双钢琴演奏方面的建议。

sentences.english: Clementi as the "father of the modern piano recital."
sentences.chinese: 克莱门蒂被誉为“现代钢琴演奏之父”。

sentences.english: Su Yunxuan's youngest daughter, Su Xiaofeng, is a pianist.
sentences.chinese: 苏云轩的小女儿苏小枫是个钢琴演奏家。

sentences.english: Pianists are less flexible than other instrumentalists.
sentences.chinese: 钢琴演奏者不如其他乐器演奏家灵活。

sentences.english: "Piano Etude " attaches great importance to the development of its performing skills.
sentences.chinese: “练习曲”对于钢琴演奏技术的发展意义重大。

sentences.english: Play The Internationale on the piano.
He would have become a fine pianist if not for that car accident.
sentences.chinese: 要是没出那场车祸，他会成为很出色的钢琴演奏家。

sentences.english: Usually there is a grand piano at a concert.
sentences.chinese: 通常音乐会都有大钢琴演奏。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
